Strength: Topic very helpful; facilitate my understanding in machine learning
Weakness: Programming not covered in lectures
Great!
It covered many useful nonparametric methods. But sometimes the pace of teaching was a little bit slow, so some slides at the end were not covered.

Strength: This lecture provides an overview to Non-parametric methods and encourages students to explore the topic they are interested in.
Weakness: Some statistical methods are not described in detail.
We can learn a lot of useful knowledge during the class and the homework assignments are practical.
useful knowledge!
Maybe a little bit superficial in terms of the coverage
This is an enjoyable class that allows me to gain knowledge in non-parametric methods with sufficient depth.
Useful knowledge.
This course was a huge learning curve for me, it gave me many opportunities to excel myself.

Great class on really important statistics topics, and a great continuation of BIS 557: Computational Statistics. Some of the lectures are a little hard to follow, but overall great class without too much work.
good
Really useful topics. Great structured course.
good
The instructor is very clear in his explanation
He is always enthusiastic and often raised real life examples to help me understand complicated concepts.
Dr. Zhang's teaching is very instructive, easy to understand.
nice professor
Good instructor with humor and very organized

Strength: Dr. Zhang is an excellent instructor and provides high-quality lectures.
Weakness: Dr. Zhang can speak a little faster.
Prof. Zhang gives very clear lectures. It would be better if he could involve more practice using R.
enthusiastic instructor
Passionate
Professor Zhang has a great teaching style. He is really good at simplifying complicated ideas and explaining abstract concept in a way that students can easily follow.
Teaching style is really interesting, but some slides in powerpoint were not covered in class.
The instructor needs to speak louder and more clearly. I had a hard time hearing him sometimes at the back. He always seemed to be unavailable and left all of his work to his TA.

Overall a good teacher who seemed very supportive and caring. Some of his lectures were a little hard to follow, and he should have given more than 2 days to write the prospectus for the final project.
good
Professor Zhang has the unique ability to enlighten us the advanced topics in the clearest and simplest way. Excellent teaching.
very good
A great course with great topic and helpful lecturer
It is a great course to learn some basis concepts of nonparametric statistics. Besides, it could help you learn to use the methods instead of just proving the theorem.
A very good course for students who want to get some ideas on nonparametric statistics. I would recommend it.
Good; would recommend
I highly recommend this course for students who may want to know more about non-parametric methods.
interactive class with useful knowledge. Recommend
An overview of nonparametric, somewhat superficial, more on the application side
I recommend this class to other students. The class provides the right amount of intellectual challenges.
I will recommend it.  Useful knowledge. Interesting class.

Both the instructor and the TA of this course for Spring 2019 seemingly lacked the motivation to teach and to help students excel. The TA once said to me that she does not have time to "coach" me as I was unable to accommodate to her office hour schedule. This so-called "coaching" only happened twice, less than 10 minutes each, inside her office. I felt extremely degraded as a student. Unless the department changes both the instructor and the TA for this course, I would not recommend students taking it.

Great class on really important statistics topics, and a great continuation of BIS 557: Computational Statistics. Some of the lectures are a little hard to follow, but overall great class without too much work.
good
Great course to learn many useful and advanced techniques.
good
